content.question: Based on Figure 1, which of the following best explains the difference in <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>ATP</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> production between these two molecules?

choices.label: <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> contributes more electrons to the electron transport chain than <math alttext="F A D H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FADH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> does and therefore provides more energy to pump protons.

The electrons of <math alttext="F A D H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FADH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are transferred through three complexes of the electron transport chain whereas those of <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are transferred through all four complexes.

<math alttext="F A D H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FADH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> contributes more protons to the mitochondrial matrix, which decreases the proton gradient.

The protons contributed by <math alttext="F A D H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FADH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are combined with <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> to make water and are not pumped across the membrane.

content.answer: The electrons of <math alttext="F A D H 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>FADH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are transferred through three complexes of the electron transport chain whereas those of <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are transferred through all four complexes.

skill.text: 2.B: Explain relationships between characteristics of biological models in both theoretical and applied contexts.
